com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.manager.configuration

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kontakt.sdk.android.ble.manager.configuration.Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FiltersConfigurator, GeneralConfigurator, SpacesConfigurator

    public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeneralConfigurator, SpacesConfigurator, FiltersConfigurator
    This class is responsible for ranging/monitoring configuration.

      • cacheFileName

        public GeneralConfigurator cacheFileName(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: GeneralConfigurator
        Cache file name for resolved shuffled device ids from Kontakt.io Proximity REST API. Cache file name must be unique for safe serialization between different InternalProximityManager used in the same app.
        Specified by:

      • deviceUpdateCallbackInterval

        public GeneralConfigurator deviceUpdateCallbackInterval(long intervalInMillis)
        Description copied from interface: GeneralConfigurator
        The device update callback interval prevents the update from being called instantly.
        Once the Android device enters a space with many BLE devices the update event starts to be called with instantly growing number of updated BLE devices.
        This may cause interruptions when interacting with UI. The device update callback interval option causes the update callback to be invoked no more often than given interval. Default: ScanContext.DEFAULT_DEVICES_UPDATE_CALLBACK_INTERVAL milliseconds.
        Specified by:
        deviceUpdateCallbackInterval in interface GeneralConfigurator
        Parameters:
        intervalInMillis - Interval in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        GeneralConfigurator builder

        public GeneralConfigurator rssiCalculator(RssiCalculator rssiCalculator)

      • eddystoneFrameTypes

        public GeneralConfigurator eddystoneFrameTypes(java.util.Collection<EddystoneFrameType> eddystoneFrameTypes)
        Description copied from interface: GeneralConfigurator
        Gets trigger frame types. The trigger frame types specify with which frame types received at least the Eddystone device should be notified.
        If not set Eddystone device will be notified as soon as any frame will be scanned (UID, URL or TLM).
        Specified by:
        eddystoneFrameTypes in interface GeneralConfigurator
        Parameters:
        eddystoneFrameTypes - eddystone format frame types
        Returns:
        GeneralConfigurator builder

      • supportNonConnectableMode

        public GeneralConfigurator supportNonConnectableMode(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: GeneralConfigurator
        Set to true if you want to support Kontakt.io devices which (for any reasons) are in NON-CONNECTABLE mode. This means those devices don't broadcast scan response data that includes:
        • Unique ID
        • Tx Power
        • Firmware version
        • Percentage battery level
        Non connectable mode support is disabled by default.
        Specified by:
        supportNonConnectableMode in interface GeneralConfigurator
        Parameters:
        enabled - true or false.
        Returns:
        GeneralConfigurator builder
